I don't want to rule this out outright yet, but I would encourage you to see if there are other options that work well for your use case.

An alternative would be to add a finalizer to the Tensor class that does the cleanup, allowing users to avoid using close() and let the resources be reclaimed on GC, or introduce the reference counts as you had proposed earlier. I'm not sure there is any perfect solution.

body:
I don't want to rule this out outright yet, but I would encourage you to see if there are other options that work well for your use case.

An alternative would be to add a finalizer to the `Tensor` class that does the cleanup, allowing users to avoid using `close()` and let the resources be reclaimed on GC, or introduce the reference counts as you had proposed earlier. I'm not sure there is any perfect solution.
